thread.title: Sarpy's weekend events: From blizzard bliss to Cajun dish
thread.title_full: Sarpy's weekend events: From blizzard bliss to Cajun dish

author: Grace Bellinghausen, The Times
title: Sarpy's weekend events: From blizzard bliss to Cajun dish
text:
Bundle up for a weekend of warmth and excitement in Sarpy County as a range of events unfold! Dive into the winter wonderland of the Shadow Lake Blizzard Bash, where live music, ice carving, and charming winter characters steal the spotlight. Embrace the festivities at Lucky Bucket Brewing's Mardi Gras celebration, where king cake brown ale is on tap and spicy Cajun delights await.
Saturday, Jan. 20
Shadow Lake Blizzard Bash
Cozy up in the warmth of heated tents, enjoy live music by Highway 6 from 4-8 p.m., encounter delightful winter characters for the kids from 2-4 p.m., indulge in a variety of food and adult beverages, and don't miss the highlight of the day â€“ continuous live ice carving throughout the free event!
Shadow Lake Towne Center, 72nd Street & Hwy 370 Papillion
2 to 8 p.m.
Lucky Bucket's Mardi Gras
Enjoy king cake brown ale, devour Cajun food and dance to performances by the Gator Boys for a celebration of Mardi Gras at Lucky Bucket Brewing. Wear your beads and don't forget to
RSVP, the party is free.
11941 Centennial Road La Vista
11 a.m. to 11 p.m.
10748 Bash Sponsored by Bon Vivant Suites & Coffee Society Cafe
Celebrate the first anniversary of Coffee Society Cafe and the grand opening of Bon Vivant Suites with a lively free event featuring a diverse pop-up shop market. Enjoy shopping from various vendors, savor special menus at Coffee Society Cafe, take tours of the newly opened Bon Vivant Suites, and anticipate exciting giveaways throughout the weekend. Pop-up vendors include Graythelabel, Frankie Dee, Kindling Co Flower Truck and
more.
10748 Virginia Plaza, La Vista
Saturday and Sunday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Women's Self-Defense Workshop
Take advantage of a free women's self defense workshop to learn and brush up on self defense skills to keep your safety a priority this year.
Agoge Martial Arts, 1258 Royal Drive, Papillion
1 to 3 p.m.
Kids' DIY-U Workshop: My First DIY Toolbox
Put your kid to work and head to Home Depot for a Kids toolbox workshop. The class is lead by Home Depot Red Vest experts and will help your little-DIYers explore the fundamentals of tools and hardware.
Home Depot, 8707 South 71st Plaza, Papillion
10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Sunday, Jan. 21
Czech Feast 2024
Czech out Lucky Bucket Brewing Company this Sunday for famous homemade Czech food with authentic recipes from the Bohemian Cafe at the taproom and jamming out with Barry Boyce.
Lucky Bucket Brewing Company, 11941 Centennial Road, La Vista
2 to 6 p.m.
Nebraska Reptile Show
Lizard lovers, snake enthusiasts and scaled creature connoisseurs unite for a one day reptile convention. This event offers a chance to engage directly with local reptile businesses. Discover thousands of reptiles, amphibians, feeders, invertebrates, and various supplies. It's a family-friendly affair, so bring your kids and explore the show. Don't miss the extensive array of supplies, from cages and tanks to bedding, toys, and decorative items. Tickets are available at the door.
Beardmore Event Center, 3730 Raynor Pkwy., Bellevue
10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

organizations.name: mardi gras at lucky bucket brewing
